ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the course for students considering the social sciences as a career path - it gives a good overview of the ways in which theory and empirical research can be reconciled and proposed within and beyond a field. I would however, recommend that it be made clear in the course description whether or not the class is open to other schools or to only sociology students.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course helped me in to recognizes potential questions around method of inquiry and theory assertion that will arise in writing my masters' thesis as both a writer, reader, and evaluator/journal editor. In particular the final assignment gave me the opportunity to frame a potential research plan that complements my current area of research. Understanding the concerns and critiques from social science perspective allowed me to comparatively look at the similarity and differences between interdisciplinary and traditional fields of research.
